meanings.sent1: The siblings were disputing over who gets to choose the TV show.
meanings.sent2: They were disputing the best way to solve the math problem.
meanings.sent3: The two friends were playfully disputing about which ice cream flavor was the tastiest.
meanings.sent4: The birds outside seemed to be disputing over the last piece of bread.
meanings.sent5: The students were loudly disputing their favorite subjects in school.

meanings.sent1: She was disputing the accusations made against her.
meanings.sent2: The witness was disputing the statement given by the suspect.
meanings.sent3: The cat was comically disputing the idea of taking a bath.
meanings.sent4: The old clock seemed to be disputing the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The toddler was vehemently disputing the idea of going to bed early.
